snippet: Jacob Ostreicher, a Brooklyn flooring contractor who went to Bolivia to seek his fortune in rice farming but ended up being accused of laundering drug money, has been spirited out of the country, an assemblyman said.
abstract: New York State Assemblyman Dov Hikind of Brooklyn reports that Brooklyn flooring contractor Jacob Ostreicher, who was jailed in Bolivia for 18 months until the intervention of actor Sean Penn lessened his punishment to house arrest, has been spirited out of Bolivia and is in the New York area; Ostreicher went to Bolivia to seek his fortune in rice farming and ended up jailed accused of laundering drug money, charge he denies.
lead_paragraph: Jacob Ostreicher, a Brooklyn flooring contractor who went to Bolivia to seek his fortune in rice farming but ended up being accused of laundering drug money, has been spirited out of the country, an assemblyman said.

headline.main: Bolivian Jail, an Actor’s Help and Now a Return to New York
headline.print_headline: Bolivian Jail, Actor’s Help, Now a Return To New York
